e.name: BLACK SUN WITH RAYS
e.desc: clear weather for Japanese mobile carriers, usually in red color

subcategory.name: Weather symbols from ARIB STD B24

e.name: HIGH VOLTAGE SIGN
e.desc: Unified with ARIB-9385=⚡ U+26A1 HIGH VOLTAGE SIGN following the pattern established by ARIB-9385 where the proposal says "different meaning but similar glyph"; see also ☇ U+2607 LIGHTNING.

e.name: CRESCENT MOON
e.ann: * may indicate either the first or last quarter moon
e.desc: Not unified with ☽ U+263D or ☾ U+263E. (Japanese carriers don't pay attention which quarter moon their symbols refer to.)

e.name: GLOWING STAR
e.desc: Animated pulsating star in orange color

e.name: SHOOTING STAR
e.desc: Animated glowing star in blue color

e.name: CLOCK FACE TEN OCLOCK
e.design: For the representative font, make it look like the rest of the SB clock series rather than making it look like the new alarm clock Emoji.

e.name: ALARM CLOCK
e.design: Make the glyph look like an alarm clock.

e.name: HOURGLASS WITH FLOWING SAND
e.desc: Sometimes animated as by KDDI/AU. Might be allocated in the U+23xx Miscellaneous Technical block with U+231B HOURGLASS=e-01C.

e.name: OPHIUCHUS
e.desc: letter symbol /Serpentarius (13th zodiacal symbol, not counted as astrological sign)

e.name: HAIRCUT
e.design: The glyph needs to represent a female as this Emoji refers to a beauty parlor.

e.name: POLICE OFFICER
e.desc: represents the police (Note: there is also just a police cap icon by Softbank.)

e.name: PERSON WITH BLOND HAIR
e.desc: both male and female icons exist

e.name: MAN WITH GUA PI MAO
e.design: The glyph should show a skullcap

e.name: JAPANESE OGRE
e.desc: In Japanese, "Oni" - could be a red or blue faced demon. Also refers to "Namahage" - a local year-end event in Akita.

e.name: DANCER
e.desc: Dancer (SoftBank = flamenco, KDDI = disco, oh well--it's their mapping)

e.name: SNAIL
e.ann: * fifth of the signs of the Asian zodiac, used in Kazakhstan

e.name: SNAKE
e.ann: * sixth of the signs of the Asian zodiac

e.name: HORSE
e.ann: * seventh of the signs of the Asian zodiac

e.name: CHICKEN
e.ann: * tenth of the signs of the Asian zodiac, used in Persia

e.name: BOAR
e.ann: * twelfth of the signs of the Asian zodiac, used in Japan

e.name: ELEPHANT
e.ann: * twelfth of the signs of the Asian zodiac, used in Thailand

e.name: MONKEY
e.ann: * ninth of the signs of the Asian zodiac

e.name: SHEEP
e.ann: * eighth of the signs of the Asian zodiac, used in Persia

e.name: BUG
e.desc: This Emoji may point to a centipede or hairy catepillar. It typically indicates something "distasteful".

e.name: FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND COLD SWEAT
SMILING FACE WITH HEART-SHAPED EYES
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-34C. used to indicate the state of being in love

e.name: FACE WITH STUCK-OUT TONGUE AND WINKING EYE
FACE WITH STUCK-OUT TONGUE AND TIGHTLY-CLOSED EYES
e.desc: with eyelids pulled down for additional effect

e.name: KISSING FACE WITH CLOSED EYES
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-34B. Puckered lips 2 (more forceful kiss, eyes squinting)

e.name: FACE WITH MEDICAL MASK
e.desc: Under the weather (wearing a breathing mask)

e.name: SMILING FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH
e.desc: May unify with ☺ U+263A WHITE SMILING FACE

e.name: SMILING FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND COLD SWEAT
e.oldname: HAPPY FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND COLD SWEAT

e.name: SMILING FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND TIGHTLY-CLOSED EYES
e.oldname: HAPPY FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND CLOSED EYES

e.name: GRINNING FACE WITH SMILING EYES
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-349. loudly laughing face with bare teeth

e.name: FACE WITH TEARS OF JOY
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-34A. with tears of joy

e.name: SMILING FACE WITH SMILING EYES
e.oldname: HAPPY FACE WITH WIDE MOUTH AND RAISED EYEBROWS

e.name: HAPPY FACE
e.desc: Possibly unify with U+263A WHITE SMILING FACE

e.name: SMILING FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND SMILING EYES
e.oldname: HAPPY FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH AND RAISED EYEBROWS

e.name: CRYING FACE
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-34D. 1 or 2 tear drops

e.name: SMILING CAT FACE WITH OPEN MOUTH
GRINNING CAT FACE WITH SMILING EYES
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-333. Hee hee hee

e.name: CAT FACE WITH TEARS OF JOY
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-334. Tears of joy

e.name: KISSING CAT FACE WITH CLOSED EYES
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-32D. Kissing action.

e.name: SMILING CAT FACE WITH HEART-SHAPED EYES
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-327. Heart shaped eyes (in love)

e.name: CRYING CAT FACE
e.desc: Forms a pair with e-339. Crying (one or two tears)

e.name: FACE WITH OK GESTURE
e.desc: OK (arms raised, making an "O") . A person or a cat

e.name: PERSON BOWING DEEPLY
e.desc: Very truly sorry, a cat or person

e.name: PERSON RAISING BOTH HANDS IN CELEBRATION
e.oldname: PERSON RAISING BOTH HANDS IN CHEERS

e.name: BOUNCING HAPPY
e.desc: Happy and bouncing up and down.

e.name: HOUSE WITH GARDEN
e.desc: similar to English "home" = "where one belongs to"

e.name: HOSPITAL
e.desc: disunified from U+26E8 (ARIB-9109: BLACK CROSS ON SHIELD) because all 3 carriers have a cross on a building while ARIB-9109 is a cross on a shield. (Note: may be controversial in Islamic and Jewish cultures)

e.name: BANK
e.desc: may contain "BK" or "Bank" letters; related to ⛻ U+26FB = ARIB-9144

e.name: HOTEL
e.desc: a building with "H"; related to U+1F157 = ARIB-9129

e.name: IZAKAYA LANTERN
e.desc: Japanese izakaya restaurant for drinking, characteristic red lantern

subcategory.name: Map symbols from ARIB STD B24

e.name: MOYAI
e.ann: * Japanese stone statue like Moai on Easter Island
e.desc: Japanese stone statue like Moai on Easter Island, famous one in Shibuya, Tokyo

e.name: WOMANS SANDAL
e.desc: woman's sandal with open toe, slipper

e.name: CROWN
e.desc: Not the same as ♕ U+2655 WHITE CHESS KING

e.name: MONEY BAG
e.desc: a bag with a dollar or yen sign
e.ann: * glyph may show any currency symbol instead of a dollar sign

e.name: CHART WITH UPWARDS TREND AND YEN SIGN
e.oldname: CHART WITH UPWARDS TREND AND YEN SYMBOL

e.name: BANKNOTE WITH YEN SIGN
e.desc: a check, a sign indicating "not free"

e.name: REGIONAL INDICATOR SYMBOL LETTERS JP
e.desc: Japan, also a national holiday (in red)

e.name: SIX POINTED STAR WITH MIDDLE DOT
JAPANESE SYMBOL FOR BEGINNER
e.desc: (In Japan) Known as the "wakaba" mark - young/green-yellow leaf. Originally referred to a newly licensed driver. Now it refers to any neophyte.

e.name: PILL
e.desc: The carrier Emoji shows a capsule but the name is simply "medicine". So a more generic name is given. Also used for cold medicine.

subcategory.name: White on black squared Latin letters

e.name: NEGATIVE SQUARED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER A
NEGATIVE SQUARED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER B
NEGATIVE SQUARED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER O
NEGATIVE SQUARED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER P
JAPANESE DOLLS
e.ann: * Japanese Hinamatsuri or girls' doll festival

e.name: FIREWORK SPARKLER
e.ann: * long, stick-like firework that looks like a burning incense stick

e.name: CONFETTI BALL
e.desc: Ornamental bag or decorative ball that opens up. Sometimes used to express "Congratulations!"

e.name: MOBILE PHONE WITH RIGHTWARDS ARROW AT LEFT
INCOMING ENVELOPE
e.desc: Mail (with cartoon movement marks). Might be allocated in the U+27xx Dingbats block with U+2709 ENVELOPE.

e.name: ENVELOPE WITH DOWNWARDS ARROW ABOVE
e.desc: Might be allocated in the U+27xx Dingbats block with U+2709 ENVELOPE.

e.name: CHEERING MEGAPHONE
e.desc: also used for a general megaphone

e.name: E-MAIL SYMBOL
e.ann: * glyph may show an @-sign instead of an E

e.name: INPUT SYMBOL FOR LATIN CAPITAL LETTERS
INPUT SYMBOL FOR LATIN SMALL LETTERS
PENCIL
e.desc: Note: pencil directions are varied among Japanese carriers, could be solid or white

e.name: HEAVY MULTIPLICATION X
e.desc: Unified with U+2716 in the Dingbats block

e.name: SEAT
e.design: the glyph should look more like SoftBank #264

e.name: FLOPPY DISK
e.ann: = flexible disk cartridge, floppy disc, floppy, diskette

e.name: SCROLL
e.desc: scroll a window on a computer

e.name: LEDGER
e.desc: real estate original record book, financial books,

subcategory.name: Map symbols from ARIB STD B24

e.name: FLAG IN HOLE
e.desc: Unified with U+26F3 = ARIB-9126. Golf (DoCoMo is golf club, others are the green and flag).

e.name: RUNNING SHIRT WITH SASH
e.desc: any sports; a sash across a running shirt to identify runner's number and team

e.name: SKI AND SKI BOOT
e.desc: ski and boots, or ski and poles. disunified from U+26F7 (ARIB-9138: SKIER) because U+26F7 is a person on a ski while all 3 carriers have a boot on a ski.

e.name: CIRCLED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER M
e.desc: Disunified from SUBWAY symbols from KDDI and Softbank. Was originally proposed as a new "METRO SIGN" symbol but then unified with Ⓜ U+24C2 CIRCLED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER M because several variants of a stylized "M" are found for different Metro systems, including a circled M. (Project issue 92.)

e.name: HIGH-SPEED TRAIN WITH BULLET NOSE
e.desc: front facing for SoftBank, used in different phone sets; old-style Japanese high-speed train; Wikipedia/Shinkansen: "The first Shinkansen trains, the 0 series [...]. The last of these trains, with their classic bullet-nosed appearance, were retired on 30 November 2008."

e.name: TAXI
e.desc: a car with light sign on the roof

e.name: MUSICAL NOTE
e.desc: Disunified from U+266A due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: PART ALTERNATION MARK
e.desc: Unified with U+303D. Part of JIS X 0213 set. indicator for the 1st vocal part of a song
e.ann: * marks the start of a song part in Japanese

e.name: HASH KEY
e.desc: pound key, number sign. Unify with ASCII # (U+0023) + (U+20E3)

e.name: KEYCAP TEN
e.design: Should look like digits 10 enclosed by a keycap like ⃣ U+20E3 COMBINING ENCLOSING KEYCAP.

e.name: FORK AND KNIFE
e.ann: * glyph may show a fork and spoon
* glyph may show a crossed fork and knife
* glyph may show a fork and knife with a plate

e.name: TEACUP WITHOUT HANDLE
e.design: Make it look like a hot tea cup without a handle used typically in China, Japan, and Korea

e.name: UPWARDS BLACK ARROW
e.desc: disunified from U+2191 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: DOWNWARDS BLACK ARROW
e.desc: disunified from U+2193 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: LEFTWARDS BLACK ARROW
e.desc: disunified from U+2190 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: BLACK RIGHTWARDS ARROW
e.desc: disunified from U+2192 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: ARROW POINTING RIGHTWARDS THEN CURVING UPWARDS
ARROW POINTING RIGHTWARDS THEN CURVING DOWNWARDS
e.desc: disunified from ↷ U+21B7. From the left curving downward ("Bad")

e.name: UP-POINTING RED TRIANGLE
e.desc: Triangle (pointing up). disunified from U+25B2 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: DOWN-POINTING RED TRIANGLE
e.desc: Triangle (pointing down). disunified from U+25BC due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: UP-POINTING SMALL RED TRIANGLE
e.desc: disunified from U+25B2 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: DOWN-POINTING SMALL RED TRIANGLE
e.desc: disunified from U+25BC due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

subcategory.name: Traffic sign from ARIB STD B24

e.name: HEAVY LARGE CIRCLE
e.desc: good, OK, correct, approved; O in tic tac toe; disunified from ○ U+25CB WHITE CIRCLE because of Shift-JIS source separation
e.ann: * forms a game tally pair with 274C

e.name: CROSS MARK
e.desc: bad; NO GOOD, not approved; X in tic tac toe. disunified from ✕ U+2715
e.ann: * forms a game tally pair with 2B55

e.name: WAVY DASH
e.desc: a wavy line, used as a wavy length mark

e.name: CURLY LOOP
e.desc: a line with a loop; new compatibility character, see e-B07=U+3030

e.name: DOUBLE CURLY LOOP
e.desc: Original name: FREE DIAL. Two loops. Occurs widely in print in Japan. Originally proposed for U+23xx.

e.name: HEART WITH ARROW
e.desc: heart with an arrow through it

e.name: HEART WITH RIBBON
e.desc: Valentine's (heart with ribbon, or candy with heart)

e.name: HEART DECORATION
e.desc: Note: Softbank ruled lines, sometimes mapped to cute heart mark in other carriers

e.name: WARNING SIGN
e.desc: Unified with U+26A0. Danger / Caution / Warning

subcategory.name: Traffic signs from ARIB STD B24

e.name: RESTROOM
e.ann: = man and woman symbol with divider

e.name: BABY SYMBOL
e.desc: used as a sign for a baby; Crawling Baby
e.ann: = baby on board, baby changing station

e.name: NO ENTRY SIGN
e.desc: Prohibited (circle with diagonal slash); Do not enter

e.name: SQUARED FREE
e.desc: a letter sign Free of Charge

e.name: SQUARED OK
e.desc: a stamp, seal, button for approval

e.name: SQUARED KATAKANA SA
e.desc: サ: KATAKANA LETTER SA; service charge; for free, on the house;

subcategory.name: Squared ideographs and kana from ARIB STD B24

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-7121
e.desc: 無: IDEOGRAPH NON-EXISTENCE; out of stock, unavailable; free

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-6307
e.desc: 指: IDEOGRAPH POINTING; reserved, designated 指定

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-7A7A
e.desc: 空: IDEOGRAPH EMPTY; Vacant, seats available

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-5408
e.desc: 合: IDEOGRAPH MATCH; approved, passed as in an examination

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-6E80
e.desc: 満: IDEOGRAPH FULL; fully occupied, full tank, etc.

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-6709
e.desc: 有: IDEOGRAPH EXISTENCE; available, in stock; charges apply

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-6708
e.desc: 月: IDEOGRAPH MOON; monthly charge, monthly rate; month

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-7533
e.desc: 申: IDEOGRAPH SAYING "application needed, apply here"

e.name: SQUARED CJK UNIFIED IDEOGRAPH-55B6
e.desc: 営: IDEOGRAPH BUSINESS; open for business 営業中; business hours 営業時間; branch office 営業所

e.name: CIRCLED IDEOGRAPH CONGRATULATION
e.desc: 祝: IDEOGRAPH CELEBRATION; celebration sign; congratulations; related to ㈷ U+3237 PARENTHESIZED IDEOGRAPH CONGRATULATION (= ARIB-9308)

e.name: CIRCLED IDEOGRAPH ADVANTAGE
e.desc: 得: IDEOGRAPH ADVANTAGE; good bargain; special tax break on public bonds

e.name: DIAMOND SHAPE WITH A DOT INSIDE
ANGER SYMBOL
e.desc: Angry (comic book style symbol where a punch lands)

e.name: DROPLET
e.ann: * represents a drop of sweat or drop of water

e.name: DASH SYMBOL
e.desc: Dash (running dash … the cloud of dust left behind)

e.name: WHITE MEDIUM STAR
e.desc: disunified from ★ U+2605 BLACK STAR and ☆ U+2606 WHITE STAR due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: LARGE RED CIRCLE
e.desc: Large circle (red). Disunified from ○ U+25CB and ◯ U+25EF due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS). Disunified from ARIB-9104=U+2B58 HEAVY CIRCLE because of different semantics. Not "WHITE LARGE CIRCLE" because the counterpart to ⬤ U+2B24 BLACK LARGE CIRCLE is ◯ LARGE CIRCLE.
e.design: Same basic shape as for ⬤ U+2B24 BLACK LARGE CIRCLE.

e.name: LARGE BLUE CIRCLE
e.desc: Large circle (blue). disunified from U+25CF due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).
e.design: Same basic shape as for ⬤ U+2B24 BLACK LARGE CIRCLE.

e.name: BLACK SQUARE BUTTON
e.design: Same shapes for e-BA3 and e-B67.

e.name: WHITE SQUARE BUTTON
e.design: Same shapes for e-BA3 and e-B67.

e.name: LARGE ORANGE DIAMOND
e.desc: Large diamond (orange). disunified from ◇ U+25C7 WHITE DIAMOND due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: LARGE BLUE DIAMOND
e.desc: Large diamond (blue). disunified from ◆ U+25C6 BLACK DIAMOND due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: SMALL ORANGE DIAMOND
e.design: Same basic shape as ⬩ U+2B29 BLACK SMALL DIAMOND

e.name: SMALL BLUE DIAMOND
e.design: Same basic shape as ⬩ U+2B29 BLACK SMALL DIAMOND

e.name: BLACK LARGE SQUARE
e.desc: Extra large square (green). disunified from U+25A0 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: WHITE LARGE SQUARE
e.desc: Extra large square (orange). disunified from U+25A1 due to source separation rule (Shift_JIS).

e.name: WHITE FLOWER
e.desc: ❀ U+2740 WHITE FLORETTE?; Symbol that a teacher writes on homework for "brilliant!" (花丸)

e.name: CLOCKWISE DOWNWARDS AND UPWARDS OPEN CIRCLE ARROWS
KEY
e.desc: Password (key). Not unified with ARIB-9071=U+26BF SQUARED KEY because no carrier shows this key in an enclosing square.

e.name: LINK SYMBOL
e.desc: Disunified from ♾ U+267E PERMANENT PAPER SIGN; Link with a twist

e.name: ON WITH EXCLAMATION MARK WITH LEFT RIGHT ARROW ABOVE
e.oldname: ON WITH DOUBLE POINTING ARROW ABOVE

e.name: EM SPACE
e.desc: Note: KDDI's Full blank (mapped to EM SPACE)

e.name: EN SPACE
e.desc: Note: KDDI's Half blank (mapped to EN SPACE)

e.name: FOUR-PER-EM SPACE
e.desc: Note: KDDI's Quarter blank (mapped to FOUR-PER-EM SQUARE)

e.name: WHITE HEAVY CHECK MARK
e.desc: Check mark (red); not unified with ✓ U+2713
e.design: Should look like a hollow version (that is, without fill) of ✔ U+2714 HEAVY CHECK MARK.

e.name: RAISED FIST
e.ann: = rock in Rock, Paper, Scissors game
e.design: Harmonize design with ✌ U+270C VICTORY HAND Dingbat.

e.name: RAISED HAND
e.ann: = paper in Rock, Paper, Scissors game
e.design: Harmonize design with ✌ U+270C VICTORY HAND Dingbat.

e.name: VICTORY HAND
e.ann: = scissors in Rock, Paper, Scissors game

e.name: WHITE UP POINTING BACKHAND INDEX
e.design: Similar to ☝ U+261D WHITE UP POINTING INDEX but showing the back of the hand instead of the palm side.

e.name: WHITE DOWN POINTING BACKHAND INDEX
e.design: Similar to ☟ U+261F WHITE DOWN POINTING INDEX but showing the back of the hand instead of the palm side.

e.name: WHITE LEFT POINTING BACKHAND INDEX
e.design: Similar to ☜ U+261C WHITE LEFT POINTING INDEX but showing the back of the hand instead of the palm side.

e.name: WHITE RIGHT POINTING BACKHAND INDEX
e.design: Similar to ☞ U+261E WHITE RIGHT POINTING INDEX but showing the back of the hand instead of the palm side.

e.name: OPEN HANDS SIGN
e.desc: Ohhaa! Good morning gesture. Open hands with the money sign

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-10
e.desc: Original name: KATAKANA ABBREVIATION FOR TICKET

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-13
e.desc: Original name: MOVIES 2; movie projector, video camera

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-23
e.desc: Original name: BLACK AND WHITE SQUARE

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-35
e.desc: Original name: CREDIT CARDS NOT ACCEPTED

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-49
e.desc: Original name: PDC; Personal Digital Cellular Symbol/Logo?

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-64
e.desc: Original name: SHIBUYA; department store by Tokyu Group for young girls/women

e.name: EMOJI COMPATIBILITY SYMBOL-66
e.desc: Original name: MOBILE Q. Mobile Q service
